intro: Dorstenia ramosa, commonly known as the wooly-dwarf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, woolly appearance and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive look. Dorstenia ramosa is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
